intro: Licania floribunda, commonly known as the red-flowered licania, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, often with a hairy texture. Licania floribunda is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
